source: Comparing the lifetime greenhouse gas emissions of electric cars with the emissions of cars using gasoline or diesel, Eindhoven University of Technology, Auke Hoekstra et.al.
assumptions: Driving distance: 250.000km. Battery manufacturing: 85 kg CO2 per kWh. Battery is assumed to last more than 250.000km. Electricity will become cleaner during the car's lifetime, 250g CO2e/kWh. Gasoline/diesel consumption is based on figures from spritmonitor.de and EPA. Emissions during fuel extraction/production is accounted for by addng 30% to tailpipe emissions. Emissions per litre: 3310g (diesel), 3140g (gasoline).
